poem:
The Medical Protest  

In white coats, they gather  
in the shade of the planet,  
voices like a gentle rain,  
stethoscopes on the world's chest.  

For the delicate theater of protest  
murmurs through generations—  
pillows of clouds, whispers of trees—  
all wanting their say  
in the language of climate.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
